result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Antonia R Weinberg in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Antonia R Weinberg.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Davila, Br. 1. 
Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report - received and filed

Court ordered no contact with SLG
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Antonia R Weinberg in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Antonia R Weinberg in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Antonia R Weinberg appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Letter from defendant re:  clearing warrant on this case.  (Antonia R. Weinberg - #1410699, Waukesha County Jail, PO Box 0217, Waukesha WI 53217).
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Antonia R Weinberg not in court.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/17/2022 @1:00pm
